choices.text:
### Human:
There are three killers in a room. Someone enters the room and kills one of them. Nobody leaves the room. How many killers are left in the room?
### Assistant:

If there were only two killers, then they would have killed each other already. So that is not possible. If there was three killers to begin with, then someone entering the room and killing one of them reduces the number of killers by 1. Therefore, if nobody leaves the room, there will be 2 killers left in it.<|im_end|>
